recipe_name: Roasted haddock with Vichy carrots and lemon
author: Garrey Dawson
method: Preheat the oven to 180C/350F/Gas 4. For the haddock, heat the oil in an ovenproof frying pan over a medium heat. Fry the haddock skin-side down first for 2-3 minutes, then turn it over and continue to cook for a further 2-3 minutes, or until the fish has browned. Season to taste with salt and freshly ground black pepper. Transfer the fish to the oven to cook for 6-8 minutes, or until it has cooked through.  For the Vichy carrots, simmer the carrot batons, butter, water and cardamom pods in a covered saucepan over a medium heat, and simmer with the lid on for 6-7 minutes, or until the carrots are tender.  To serve, spoon the Vichy carrots onto a serving plate with the roasted haddock, and garnish with the lemon wedges.
ingredients: 1 tbsp olive oil,  100g/3½oz haddock fillet, skin on,  salt and freshly ground black pepper,  4 carrots, peeled and cut into batons,  25g/1oz butter,  100ml/3½fl oz boiling water,  4 cardamom pods, crushed,  ½ lemon, cut into wedges, to serve
